basics.name: Elaine Yeung
basics.label: Software developer
basics.summary: Prior to software engineering, Elaine worked in early childhood education for eight years, serving the last four as an assistant principal in Houston, Texas. Before that, she interned for the Texas State Legislature and the US Department of Justice. Her frustration with educational technology led to my decision to change careers and study software development. I enjoy programming as an outlet for me to creatively and analytically express myself.

highlights: Developed tool to send Google Cloud resource quota percentages via Slack notifications
Built prototype of Sentry engineering's internal development environment using Docker Compose
Transitioned organization from self-hosted Docker registry to Google Cloud Platform Container Registry
Integrated Google Cloud Container Builder to build Docker images for our deploy pipeline
Developed garbage collection tool to clean up old images from Google Cloud Container Registry
Delivered professional development in leveraging data collected from blended learning programs
Managed campus inventory and administration of 210 iPads and 300 Chromebooks
Campus Coordinator for annual state test (STAAR) overseeing compliance with district and state policies
Oversaw the expansion of blended learning from two to five grade levels so that all students from kindergarten and up have up to 110 minutes of individualized instruction each day

work.position: DEAN OF TECHNOLOGY, DATA AND SYSTEMS
highlights: Authored two successful grant applications resulting in funds totaling over $100,000 to purchase Chromebooks
Promoted within school because of demonstrated leadership skills and ability to drive student achievement
Recruited to be a founding teacher in one of ten kindergarten classrooms at KIPP Legacy

work.company: State Senator Rodney Ellis, Austin, TX

work.position: COMMUNITY RELATIONS SERVICE, ORGANIZATION OF CHINESE AMERICANS INTERN
work.company: US Department of Justice, Washington, DC

courses: StarCraft II Learning Environment in Docker https://github.com/yeungegs/botbier
Designed final project for Holberton to align with interests in StarCraft II (SC2) and automation
Reduced barriers to SC2 Learning Environment setup through improved documentation and containerization in Docker
Collaborated with engineers from Blizzard and Deep Mind at invitation only SC2 AI workshop to improve project design
Applied knowledge of stack and queue concepts to create an interpreter of bytecode files

education.area: University Scholars Program with concentrations in sociology, political science and philosophy

StarCraft II Artificial Intelligence workshop attendee
